meanings.definition: Misfaiths: false beliefs or lack of trust
meanings.sent1: Her misfaiths in the rumors led to unnecessary worry.
meanings.sent2: The misfaiths in the old superstitions caused confusion.
meanings.sent3: His misfaiths in the weather forecast made him carry an umbrella on a sunny day.
meanings.sent4: The misfaiths in his abilities held him back from trying new things.
meanings.sent5: The misfaiths in the unreliable source led to wrong decisions.

meanings.definition: Misfaiths: to have incorrect beliefs or doubts
meanings.sent1: She misfaiths the intentions of others too easily.
meanings.sent2: They misfaith that the world is always fair.
meanings.sent3: He misfaiths his memory when it comes to dates.
meanings.sent4: The child misfaiths that monsters hide under the bed.
meanings.sent5: The student misfaiths the answer and gets it wrong.

meanings.sent1: The misfaiths of the cult followers led to tragic outcomes.
meanings.sent2: Their misfaiths in the false prophet caused chaos.
meanings.sent3: The misfaiths in the magical amulet brought laughter to the skeptics.
meanings.sent4: The misfaiths in luck being on their side proved to be false.
meanings.sent5: The misfaiths in the ancient relic turned out to be baseless.
